channel.title: eBulletin
channel.description:
Yea, So I decided I wanna work on my PHP and MySQL skills and make a forum software. I'll list my current progress and the link to the demo.
Base: - A simple posting script. You type in your username, subject, and message and it posts the topic in the index. - A login script. Just for logging :p
What I've done: - Integrated the posting script with the registration script - Started on Admin CP - Work on layout - Made an advanced navigation system. Admin CP shows up for member only, Logout shows up for logged in ppl only, etc. - Started a profile page...Haven't made it visible yet for registered users.
Upcoming updates: - Smiley System - Profile Page release - News Bulletin - Quick reply - Private Messaging - Boards and categories!(oboi <.<)
Current progress/demo: [url=http://ebulletin.ballindesign.com/]http://ebulletin.ballindesign.com/[/url]
Current bugs: - You cannot put this in a sub-directory. This has to go in your main directory. So, you can put it in a /forums/ directory. it has to be: yourdomain.com/index.php
Post feedback and suggestions.
NOTE: I AM NOT A PROFESSIONAL PROGRAMMER. DON'T BE A DICKHEAD AND POST "OMG, THAT SUCKS, AMG!"

Just a couple suggestions.

  1. have a variable for the URL so you can have it in subdirectories
  2. in your main ‘global’ file, have something SIMILAR to this: define(“ROOT”, dirname(FILE)); so you can use ROOT.“xxxx.php” to include a file that is in the root directory from any file
